author: petervg
title: Factpage: Cardano fact check site
description: Les fausses nouvelles et la désinformation concernant Cardano sont renforcées lorsque les faits ne peuvent pas être vérifiés de manière indépendante et séparés des faussetés.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal meets the requirements of the fund challenge setting and also is quite scalable in terms of the way they are designing their system to handle a variety of situations to assess whether it is factual or not.
f6_assessments.q1: The skills listed of the developers planning to develop this solution definitely appear to have enough experience to deliver on a project like this.  Their outline of the roadap and where the Fund 7 funds would get the project to are nice detail to highlight the complexity of the solution that they are proposing.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal highlights the items that would make their proposal very transparent and visible for auditing purposes.  They have deliverables timed, a breakdown of funds, and a roadmap going through to solution completion.

f6_assessments.q0: This is an extraordinary proposal. Not only it has a clear understanding of the challenge and its goals, but it solves its main question splendidly. The source of the problem of the challenge is isolated and clearly identified, it is the lack of auditability of some facts that are used to distort information and create fake news and scams. The solution proposed addresses this problem in a brilliant way and with an unbelievable solidity. They explain that by building Factpage not only they are creating a repository of media using verified audit trails, but they are also classifying them in terms of different qualities effectively creating a taxonomy, which in turn will add value to the Cardano ecosystem because truth about Cardano and ongoing and past events will be much easier to be established even for beginners. The key metrics used are highly aligned with the outlined challenge settings. For instance, enhancement of transparency and the construction of a repository of scam attempts are some of them. Finally, they have discussed as well, paths to achieve scalability in the future by means of reliably automating different tools that will be used, which will turn the solution to a decentralized model.
f6_assessments.q1: A lot of evidence of relevant skills and experience was given to support the naming of Peter Van Garderen and Dr. Hossain Maserrat to the project. The proposal describes their professional past as well as provide LinkedIn links to further explore their professional career. Also, they have estimated the type and number (just two) of team members required for the project. Moreover, the budget is well explained, broken down into identifiable items that are granular enough and the total amount asked for is reasonable. The timetable is realistic and takes into account that only the first 3 months will be sponsored by the fund resources. They are very clear in describing how each phase will develop what they have proposed. For example, they explain how they intend to construct a proof-of-fact explorer and how they intend to escalate in the future, making everything they can automated.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap traced is over the top. It has enough milestones and they all are relevant. Plus, the time horizon is pretty reasonable. Besides that, the metrics defined are strongly aligned with the goals of the challenge. For example, they set making truth easier to be established even for newcomers and transperancy being enhanced two metrics to be pursued. However, more quantifiable KPIs could have been defined such as number of scam attempts in the repository or amount of information regarding Cardano treasury. Finally, the solution is understandable and addresses the problem if it succeeds.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project aims at developing a website "FactPage" gathering articles and media about Cardano created by reputable original sources. The purpose of this page is not to be the source of the truth, but to enable users to easily check an information with the appropriate original source.
The main added value comes from the classification of media to assist the user in finding relevant fact checking information. 
The proposal clearly articulates with the challenge goals and show how value is added to Cardano through a shield against disinformation attacks. I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The two team members are identified by their LinkedIN profile. They list the skills necessary to implement the project. They are currently prototyping the Orcfax oracle solution, a Fund 6 successfully funded project. 
The detailed plan and the description of the solution give confidence in the project: expectations and challenges are well identified.
Orcfax project has been funded in F6 and is still under development, FactPage will not mobilize other ressources than the 2 team members. I recommend the proposer to elaborate on to risk conducting the two developments simultaneously during the first 6 months of 2022.
Based on my understanding of the proposal, I agree that it is likely to be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
The budget breakdown mentions a server cost and developers hourly rates. Success is well defined, along with a quite precise roadmap. As a proof of concept is expected after two months, and a MVP after 3 months, the progress will be monitored by following the roadmap and publications of results.
I agree that the community will be able to monitor the progress of this project.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal really addresses the challenge as it wants to archive media about Cardano using the verifiable audit trails implemented in the Orcfax oracle project (a successful proposal has been funded in Fund 6) and publish an explorer called fact.page. This is not only a brilliant idea on how gather authentic history of information about Cardano at a place, but also a powerful tool when it offers people a repository to look up for the facts being officiallly published by Cardano. And then they will decide/ verify their concerns by themselves. This makes the platform a place to get trustful references, without usual worries - to be misled and manipulated. I rate this proposal for the highest score of 5 for its impact to Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
I have checked Orcfax and all the references they attached, I can see the team really dug into the problem and has their methodology of "proof-of-fact", which is powered by a set of tools W3C specs, IPFS, DAGs and Cardano notarization. 
This proposal is in-charged by a powerful team. Although the rate of $75/ per hour * 360 hours makes the cost for developers take nearly one third of this challenge budget, but they do give clear explanation for this rate, so I think it's acceptable. 
The development plan of this proposal is clearly divided into 3 processes and well written in each. Timeline is also well allocated. It's highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: I can see metrics and KPIs of this proposal is thoroughly considered by the team. They plan details on how and when each version of this fact.page will be updated. This proposal provides me with sufficient information to access the progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
While factpage does not tackle disinformation directly, it can go a long way in helping to find reliable and verifiable information. This is one response to the fight against disinformation. Therefore, it is a good idea to proposal.
Additional info on the original media source and the link to orcfax would help.
Concrete examples should be given of documents that the factpage could or could not exclude to make certain information more readable.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is directly connected to orcfax, we must not forget to mention it and its development is linked. It may need to be integrated into the road map.
Data storage must be quantified and evaluated.
The costs are detailed and in line with the roadmap
f6_assessments.q2:
The milestones are clearly mentioned but information is lacking on the expected results and what evaluation criteria are set.
Perhaps a period of community testing should be added.

solution: Archiver les médias concernant Cardano en utilisant les pistes d'audit vérifiables mises en œuvre dans le projet Orcfax oracle et publier un explorateur sur fact.page.
experience: L'équipe de développement d'Orcfax met en œuvre des "preuves de fait" fiables et décentralisées en utilisant les spécifications W3C, IPFS, DAG et la notarisation Cardano.
